Docs.param: Number of bits used per components.
The data provider for this bitmap

If this value is non-null, the array should contain pairs of (low,high) values for each channel that will be used to interpolate each component in the image. The interpolation is a simple linear interpolation from the source range to the low,high range. An RGB buffer would have 6 elements (two for each channel).
Whether edges will be smoothed out
Determines how to handle colors that are outside of the requested colorspace.
Docs.summary: Creates an image.

MemberSignature.Value: public static MonoMac.CoreGraphics.CGImage CreateMask (int width, int height, int bitsPerComponent, int bitsPerPixel, int bytesPerRow, MonoMac.CoreGraphics.CGDataProvider provider, float[] decode, bool shouldInterpolate);

.method public static hidebysig class MonoMac.CoreGraphics.CGImage CreateMask(int32 width, int32 height, int32 bitsPerComponent, int32 bitsPerPixel, int32 bytesPerRow, class MonoMac.CoreGraphics.CGDataProvider provider, float32[] decode, bool shouldInterpolate) cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates an image mask.

remarks.para: Image masks can be 1, 2, 4 or 8 bits per component. 1-bit masks are the simplest ones as they either allow painting (the mask is set to zero) or not (the mask bit is set to one). For 2, 4 and 8 the values the values are interpolated between the possible range.
Masks are used to filter how drawings are taking place. Zero values in a mask allow painting to take place, a value of one would mask out the rendering.

Docs.summary: To be added.
To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose() cil managed

Docs.summary: Releases the resources used by the CGImage object.

remarks.para: The Dispose method releases the resources used by the CGImage class.

Calling the Dispose method when you are finished using the CGImage ensures that all external resources used by this managed object are released as soon as possible. Once you have invoked the Dispose method, the object is no longer useful and you should no longer make any calls to it. For more information on releasing resources see ``Cleaning up Unmananaged Resources'' at http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/498928w2.aspx

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose(bool disposing) cil managed

param.name: disposing
param.para: If set to , the method is invoked directly and will dispose manage and unmanaged resources; If set to the method is being called by the garbage collector finalizer and should only release unmanaged resources.

Docs.summary: Releases the resources used by the CGImage object.

remarks.para: This Dispose method releases the resources used by the CGImage class.

This method is called by both the Dispose() method and the object finalizer (Finalize). When invoked by the Dispose method, the parameter disposting is set to and any managed object references that this object holds are also disposed or released; when invoked by the object finalizer, on the finalizer thread the value is set to .

Calling the Dispose method when you are finished using the CGImage ensures that all external resources used by this managed object are released as soon as possible. Once you have invoked the Dispose method, the object is no longer useful and you should no longer make any calls to it.

For more information on how to override this method and on the Dispose/IDisposable pattern, read the ``Implementing a Dispose Method'' document at http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/fs2xkftw.aspx

MemberSignature.Value: public static MonoMac.CoreGraphics.CGImage FromJPEG (MonoMac.CoreGraphics.CGDataProvider provider, float[] decode, bool shouldInterpolate, MonoMac.CoreGraphics.CGColorRenderingIntent intent);

.method public static hidebysig class MonoMac.CoreGraphics.CGImage FromJPEG(class MonoMac.CoreGraphics.CGDataProvider provider, float32[] decode, bool shouldInterpolate, valuetype MonoMac.CoreGraphics.CGColorRenderingIntent intent) cil managed

Docs.param: The data provider that contains a JPEG-encoded image.

If this value is non-null, the array should contain pairs of (low,high) values for each channel that will be used to interpolate each component in the image. The interpolation is a simple linear interpolation from the source range to the low,high range. An RGB buffer would have 6 elements (two for each channel).
Whether edges will be smoothed out
Determines how to handle colors that are outside of the requested colorspace.
Docs.summary: Creates a CGImage from a JPEG-encoded image.

Docs.param: The data provider that contains a PNG-encoded image.

If this value is non-null, the array should contain pairs of (low,high) values for each channel that will be used to interpolate each component in the image. The interpolation is a simple linear interpolation from the source range to the low,high range. An RGB buffer would have 6 elements (two for each channel).
Whether edges will be smoothed out
Determines how to handle colors that are outside of the requested colorspace.
Docs.summary: Creates a CGImage from a PNG-encoded image.
Handle (pointer) to the unmanaged object representation.

Docs.summary: The image height in pixels.
Whether this image is a mask or a bitmap.
The rendering intent.
Docs.remarks: The intent determines how to handle colors that are outside of the requested colorspace.

Docs.summary: Creates a copy of the image based on the specified colorspace.
Docs.remarks: This method could return null if the image is a mask, or if there is a colorspace component mismatch between the images.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class MonoMac.CoreGraphics.CGImage WithMaskingColors(float32[] components) cil managed

Docs.param: Array contains pairs of (min,max) floats for each component.
Docs.summary: Creats a new image by masking the values in the image with the specified components.
Docs.remarks: If the image has three components (RGB for example) the components array should contains six values.
